Posts.Content: juliarose wrote: HELLO, AS YOU CAN SEE IN MY OTHER POSTS I AM HAVING a CORE BIOPSY ON THE 9TH, THE SURGEON SAID MY CHANCES WERE 90 PERCENT BENIGN OR 10 PERCENT CANCER, THERE IS NO LUMP IT SHOWS A SHADOW ON THE MAMMO BUT NOTHING ON ULTRASOUND ITS PERFECTLY ROUND NO CALCIFCATIONS OR ITS NOT SPICULATED, BUT DUE TO THE FACT IT WAS NOT THERE LAST YEAR ITS A BIRAD 4,,, I JUST NEED ANSWERS TO FIND OUT IF OTHER SURGEONS HAVE SAID THIS TO  PATIENTS AND IF THEY HAVE BEEN ON TARGET, THANKS VERY MUCH Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: HAS ANYONE GETTING A BIOPS BEEN GIVEN A PERCENTAGE? juliarose sheila888

Posts.Content: Sep 4, 2009 06:34AM - edited Sep 4, 2009 06:40AM by juliarose well the first thing they should have done was give an ultrasound to see if solid of cyst,,, they can't tell what mine is since its not on the ultrasound and there is no mass or lump, that can be felt upon mine examination and the dr's----, but did they tell you there is a 50 percent chance it could be cancer did they give any percentage,,, I have been googling all the time on this thing and can't see if surgeons give patients percentages... If I hear that they always say 90 percent then I will not be too happy,, I am thinking 90 percent is good but are there people on here that have been diagosed that are in my situation I only want to know for statistic purposes,, I am 46 no history of breast cancer.. thanks in advance

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2009 09:58AM juliarose wrote: Yes never did yours,,, my situation seems the same as yours also to be honest, its most likely the same exact thing,, but it doesn't hurt to get it out,,, my scar is not that bad its only 2 inches and its already fading but I am not sure if I knew thats what is was I would ahve done anything, best of luk to you though.... Its obviously a fibranoma too
Posts.Title: To all the wonderful people on this board juliarose flash

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2009 09:53AM juliarose wrote: thanks so much everyone yes I am leaving early to pick my daughter from school and jsut grab her, and take her out for lunch...... I think I might even do kareoke this weekend, even though I can't sing but who cares... and yes they said nothing came up on ultrasound so how was it a fibranoma????? the dr didn't get into any specifics she jsut said good news this is what it is and we shall see you in a year,,, so with that I said thank you and that was it,,, will they even send me anything or should I ask????/ I am thinking tey have to mail me information right??? I don't know but I am o cloud nine now so thanks again
Posts.Title: To all the wonderful people on this board juliarose flash

Posts.Content: juliarose wrote: I got my call today and it was benign its a fibroadenoma, I am still in a state of shock and happiness I can't even focus,,, but I would never have been able to get thru this without the wonderful people on here who where so great to me, the advice that was given the compassion that was felt, the prayers that were answered,,,,, I thought once this was over I would leave this site but I will never leave this site, the positive vibes and the love that is on this site is overwelming, I want to know about everyone and I want to share my experiences with others who might be in a similiar situation.... Thank you so much for everything and Breast Cancer to me is no longer something someone else gets but its real and I will rememeber and get involved in everything I can to help others, I hope this makes me a better person... I love you all... thanks... Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: To all the wonderful people on this board juliarose flash

Posts.Content: Sep 21, 2009 12:34PM juliarose wrote: Ad everyone knows I was tortured with the same exact feelings and it turned out to be a fibranoma, I was ready to jump under a bus, so please don't freak out, I did and I can't those days back,,,, best of luck
Posts.Title: Freaking out again - finally read mammo / us report brady0819 flash

Posts.Content: Sep 22, 2009 10:49AM juliarose wrote: Hi, I sat in bed for 5 days crying and not eating and vomiting, I searched on the internet constantly shich by the way makes it so much worse its not even funny, I did however hold on to a coupleo f things, I remember my dr saying they have to notate a birad 4 if they need a biopsy because thats the only way to justify it to the insurance company to pay for it, so that eased my mined a bit plus also the fact that everywhere and the dr. said its usually 80 percent benign...... my was also oval and "macro"lobulated.  which was a good thing, no spiculation or  calcifications , actually it sounds exactly like yours, except mine was at 6:00 do you feel anything, at first I didn't feel anything then I thought I could, but it was slightly moveable, it could have been my mind palying tricks on me because I was in such a state of horror,,,, but after the excsional biopsy 7 days later I get a call saying Hi the reults are benign it was a fibranoma, and I just remember being happy except for htis thick scar around the bottom of my breast which is very tiny buit its hard and lumpy,, if you have any questions email me,,,,,,, best of luck, I am sure you will be fine
